smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided PDF contain elements and are not empty.
In the Use Case diagram (Page 2), all use cases (oval elements) are connected to actors or other use cases.
No use cases were found with synonymous names associated with the same actor. 'Vaata aktiivseid parklakohti' and 'Vaata kõiki parklakohti' describe different scopes of activity.
No package contains multiple model elements with the exact same name.
The DDL diagram (Page 13) shows a normalized structure using Foreign Keys (e.g., 'FK_isikukoodi_riik') to reference data, avoiding redundant data columns without connections.
All use cases on Page 2 (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Registreeri parklakoht', 'Aktiveeri parklakoht') consistently start with a verb in the imperative mood.
In the State Diagram (Page 10), all states (e.g., 'Ootel', 'Aktiivne', 'Unustatud') are reachable from the Start node via transitions.
All actions in the Activity Diagrams (Pages 3 and 4) are reachable via the control flow arrows.
Relationships on the class and DDL diagrams (e.g., Page 5, Page 12) have multiplicity indicators (such as '1', '0..1', '0..*') at both ends.

The Use Case diagram on Page 2 contains 11 central use case elements (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Registreeri parklakoht', etc.), which exceeds the limit of 10. The DDL diagram on Page 13 also contains significantly more than 10 tables.

On the DDL diagram (Page 13), the table 'Tootaja' has 6 distinct visual connection lines to other tables: 'Isik', 'Tootaja_seisundi_liik', 'Tootaja' (self-reference), 'Parklakoht' (via FK_registreerija), 'Parklakoht' (via FK_viimane_muutja), and 'Tootaja_rolli_omamine'.
The layout of the diagrams is balanced, and no related elements are placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.

In the activity diagram 'Aktiveeri parklakoht tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4), the action 'Parklakoht aktiveeritud' describes a state (passive participle) rather than starting with an active verb. Similarly, 'Aktiveerimine ebaõnnestub' is a noun phrase describing an event.
All class, table, attribute, and use case names found are longer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik' and 'Riik' are 4 characters long).
All class names (e.g., 'Isik', 'Parklakoht', 'Tootaja') start with an uppercase letter and are singular.
On Page 12 ('Parklate register'), the class 'Parkla' contains the attribute 'Aadress', which incorrectly starts with an uppercase letter.
Table names in the DDL diagram (Page 13) are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Parklakoht', 'Tootaja').
Names do not use Hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., 'aadress' is used instead of 'strAadress'). Prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_', 'pfK' found in the DDL are explicitly allowed by the rule.
